column1: Tis' the season for truthtelling confronting history & ourselves. Nothing can be changed until it is faced. Anti-racism education & policies will bring us one step closer to liberation.  We mourn the loss of indigenous ancestors to settler colonialism & recent losses to Covid. https://t.co/89f2QSktyN

While everyday my office gets calls from families with loved one who are incarcerated & at risk of COVID19 - including pregnant folks senior citizens and folks pre trial - the impeached and soon to be evicted Occupant is pardoning this man.   We have 2 broken legal systems. https://t.co/lceI4C0Tj3

Unemployment is unprecedented. In truth pre covid there was already an unemployment crisis in marginalized communities including & especially for persons with disabilities. Cc @workinc @nickcollinsma #CripTheVote #mapoli https://t.co/r7XlUkdOYE

I firmly insist that you comment ONLY on my policy proposal to alleviate a crisis in the trillions burdening families. Student debt cancelation will ensure an equitable economic recovery from COVID-19  jumpstart our economy & close the racial wealth gap. One more thing https://t.co/pazxbJuPfM

PSA: The COVID-19 hurt is deep & the struggle is real for everyone including our small businesses. Emergency relief is here! Apply if you are in need or forward to another small business owner you know. #mapoli @revrenddoctor @AmplifyLatinx https://t.co/C5ZbVTqrPQ

We've the worst COVID-19 infection rates we've ever seen & the highest in the world! The Science Denier in Chief Donald J. Trump believes we are "rounding a corner"the virus will just "disappear go away". It won't. Neither will he fr the Oval office. EVICT this dangerous fool.

Pence didn't come to debate he came to play dodge ball. He dodged on COVID-19 response dodged on pre-existing conditions dodged on abortion dodged on peaceful transfer of power. #MikePence dodged everything but that fly #Debates2020

There’s a COVID outbreak in the Senate.  They refuse to pass a relief bill & yet they’re trying to ram through a Supreme Court nominee just so they can tear healthcare away from millions of people. In a pandemic.  No confirmation until inauguration. https://t.co/L2q8EwNPQ3

.@RobinLynneKelly is a strong advocate for the health & safety of our communities and a champion for policies that make meaningful change. I’m so glad to have worked alongside her for an equitable public health response to the COVID crisis & our work together continues. https://t.co/5D3OSCkmPe

TY @alexjgoldstein. A damning  commentary on the criminal negligence and science denials of the Trump Administration. Yesterday we lost 1000 people souls not just stats on a projection model @FacesOfCOVID https://t.co/0gIkY6DnHf

Pres. @BostonNAACP1911 @attorneytanisha the Exec. Cmte mbrs & vols have done an extraordinary job in transitioning to a virtual national convention in light of COVID-19. Boston is home to many firsts including as the first chartered branch in the country. Always leading. https://t.co/6p8X7Fa8Fe

Explain to me how you could live through the COVID19 crisis and not support Medicare for All.  There’s no doubt that in any just and decent society COVID testing treatment & vaccines (when we have one) should be free.

We have 15 days until rent is due again and major protections in the last COVID relief package expire.  The Heroes Act has been sitting on your desk for 60 days @senatemajldr   Do your job and pass that damn bill

Black disabled lives matter.  I’m devastated. It wasn’t just COVID19 that robbed Michael Hickson of his life. It was racism & ableism.  I’m praying for his wife & children. In his name we fight for true liberation.  Say his name #MichaelHickson https://t.co/hFY7gEE2S0

@marconya @cityofeverettma @joekennedy Yes THIS absolutely is. Concern for your neighbor mutual aid pride for the city & love for the community. I've seen it on full display on many occasions including at the height of COVID-19 when my team & I came to volunteer at the very same pantry. @BColoyan @ErinaColombo

“In Washington Pressley has filed legislation at a rapid clip during the COVID pandemic and the anti-police-violence protests — bills covering everything from data collection to qualified immunity” @YawuMiller @BayStateBanner  https://t.co/XPhJ8sAKYj
Big C & Little C. Straight outta COVID-19 Wakanda. https://t.co/8B8X5XsvKX

This interview w/Black Funeral Dir. Isaiah Owens hit me hard. From lynchings to police brutality to the coronavirus Funeral Dirs have been on the frontlines providing Black families & our movements w/the comfort & resource we need even in the midst of their own trauma. #BLM https://t.co/5sVhKKbmQ1

No one should die in the back of a police car pleading for their life. No one should die in a prison their body ravaged by COVID and medical care denied. When an officer denies a person medical care they must be held accountable. @ElizabethWarren & I have a bill to do just that https://t.co/UBGK5f5eUM
Live on @WCVB talking about paid leave & hazard pay for our essential workers and the #COVID19 response in Chelsea Randolph and across the MA 7th.

UPDATE Heroes Act includes student debt cancellation   @IlhanMN @ewarren @AlmaforCongress @MadeleineDean & I have been fighting for this since the start of #COVID19 right alongside you  ☎️Call your Rep at (202) 224-3121 tell them firsthand you want Congress to #CancelStudentDebt https://t.co/kJHEOf7zs8

@jessemermell This is a timeless hair style JM. It is certainly making a comeback during COVID-19 with all of the home barbering. I was & always will be a sucker for a snaggled toothed grin. Cora got whatever she wanted when she was missing her 2 front teeth.

Co-sign. “This is a critical time for all of us particularly Boston’s black community. Not only does the COVID-19 pandemic threaten our lives at disproportionate rates but the economic standstill threatens our livelihood as well.” @revrenddoctor  https://t.co/UA2bBGuySq
That’s right.  Coronavirus isn’t just a health crisis in #Chelsea.   It’s also an environmental crisis. https://t.co/6Ymnguhq2i

Andrea Circle Bear should be alive. Holding her newborn baby in her arms. Instead she died in prison from #COVID19. Every day @OfficialFBOP refuses to act puts lives in danger #decarceratenow #sayhername #restinpower https://t.co/6geNwuKotJ

@yonderis This is a Twitter thread in support of my fellow survivors of rape & our Boston Area Rape Crisis Ctr after our virtual fundraising walk. It is also an online community to support  those living w/domestic violence during COVID-19 #stayathomes These folx are "struggling" too.
@AshaMNoor @StFleur @BMCoalition Yes I already follow them on insta & they recently participated in our CBC webinar on the COVID-19 response (the lack thereof) for incarcerated men & women.
We are physically distancing because of COVID-19 but truth be told for many survivors we've been doing that along with socially isolating since our hurt trauma & loss first occurred.

@Bebop_Cowboi @IbrahimTanner1 @princss6 @JacksonLeeTX18 @EbonyUceo It wasn't BS. My Dad was incarcerated 14yrs. I saw my younger self in her emotional pleas & was moved. I am an active prison abolitionist & author of the Peoples Justice Guarantee. I do the work. The webinar was to educate others to join our decarceration efforts during COVID.

BREAKING The final text of the next #COVIDー19 bill includes our racial data #ReleasetheData bill and it just passed the Senate.  This will save lives.   The Work continues. Thank you for your partnership & fierce advocacy @BLeeForCongress @KarenBassTweets @RepRobinKelly @ewarren

@14thAndUnion @justicedems Esp when my comment was made in response to Black & other minority small biz being disadvantaged in access to the relief grants & loans & the same being true when it comes to healthcare access & resources commensurate with higher COVID-19 impact in the Black community.

@1richardleite @justicedems @RashidaTlaib Our most vulnerable have always been communities of color our elderly low income families the uninsured & undocumented those exp homelessness etc & each are highly represented in COVID-19 cases & fatalities. Sadly it was predictable who would suffer the most.

@DrSagger @justicedems I am Black & a woman. I am well aware of our *disparate access to healthcare the impacts of structural racism* resulting in a higher representation of co-morbidities=hardest hit by COVID-19. The issue is racism. The issue is a disparate public health response.

BREAKING @CDCgov just announced they’re adopting key tenants of our racial data bill. Daily #COVID19 data will save lives. Now let’s make sure every level of gov is acting on these reports in real time to support our communities of color & the disability community

I’ll be on the phone with @stevenmnuchin1 momentarily. It’s clear our communities in the MA7th are hurting and need access to relief checks SBA loans and additional #COVID19 resources. What would you say to him if you were on the call?

Black folx we are resilient but we are not invincible.  Thank you @Diddy for bringing so many people together for a powerful conversation about #COVID19 and the State of Black America https://t.co/7BCGFn8orl

@malbisse Do you know WHY you actually know men are being hit harder with COVID-19? Because data on age & gender is already being collected & reported publicly. It matters & informs how healthcare professionals educate contain & respond to the virus.

Tonight I’ll be hosting another 📞Town Hall with real time updates on #COVID19 dial 855-962-1037 at 6pm to join  For those observing the holiday we’ll be sure to wrap before sundown & for those pacing news consumption we’ll have this up on our website for you to listen to anytime

RIP my mentions w/all of the victim blaming re: disproportionate COVID-19 deaths in the Black community. No one is playing victim (we are resilient) or the "race card". Your willful ignorance is exhausting. Systemic oppression thru structural racism is real.

Do you know why African-Americans align with so many COVID-19 co-morbidities? Structural racism. Food deserts=unequal access to healthy & fresh foods= diabetes heart disease. Enviro injustices mean dirty air water. Greed & neglect subpar housing=asthma
Race specific #COVID19 data would help us adjust our response in real time in MA. I’m asking @MassGovernor to release this data publicly. https://t.co/gH3Fmua470
Pressley Wants Race-Specific Coronavirus Data Requirement In Next Relief Bill https://t.co/I4eABIkWFi via @WBUR

We are all in this together. We need data disaggregated by race to respond in real time to inequities in access to #COVID19 testing & treatment  Joining @craigmelvin on @MSNBC soon to talk about why @SenWarren @SenKamalaHarris @SenBooker @RepRobinKelly &I are calling for data now https://t.co/Tweg1mRymD

@wo_landa I share your fears & concerns. Navigating the world for us has always meant to feel constantly vulnerable. On top of this we have high % of underlying conditions & represent highest % of COVID-19 fatalities.

Unfathomable that we would use government resources to deport people during a global pandemic. Reckless actions that will spread #COVID19 further. I’m calling on @ICEgov to halt these deportations immediately https://t.co/fzisNx4jbn

I was in back to back zoom meetings so I missed the video roll call but I'm here for the Twitter one. S/O to @_messinabottle #mbe for the awesome t-shirt! #baldbaddies  #baldiemovement #alopecia PSA: #coronavirus #stayathome #washyourhands https://t.co/aFbacZLMiu

Donald J. Trump's misinformation campaign contd in today's presser jeopardizing lives in the process. I wish I had counted how many times he recklessly played Dr. today prescribing Rx cocktails for people against COVID-19 asking "What do you have to lose?" Really? Their lives!

TY to mainstream & ethnic media national & local TV & print for keeping the public informed & more safe via your reporting. Special S/O to @SHODesusAndMero for having Dr. Fauci on last night to educate our young people about their risk & responsibility in the face of COVID-19. https://t.co/ISx1OnohoC
Democratic lawmakers including Warren and Pressley call for racial data in coronavirus testing https://t.co/uHOI1I0Saa

Thank you for the compassionate and efficient response from the frontline healthcare workers at @MassGeneralNews who treated me and the hundreds more who had presented with #COVID19 symptoms that day. You are our heroes and I will keep fighting to get you the resources you need.

Relieved to share that I have tested negative for #COVID19. I am at home recovering from the flu and working remotely with my team to support our community through this crisis.  I am touched by the outpouring of support and concern for me and my family. ♥️

Thanks for the well wishes all. At home in Boston with my family getting some rest and awaiting #COVIDー19 test results.  Sending our continued gratitude to all of the healthcare workers on the frontlines of this fight in Massachusetts.  https://t.co/2ZRSdGWN3J

.@SenSanders and I know that our Community Health Centers are on the frontlines of the #COVIDー19 pandemic and serving so many of our uninsured neighbors. Robust funding for our CHCs is critical right now. https://t.co/VvHvKKM6EH

We have been robbed of 5 lives by #COVIDー19 in Massachusetts as of today including a Boston resident a constituent of mine.  My heart goes out to their families. We have to double down on our response and work relentlessly to manage this crisis. We are in this together.

“Nothing about us without us” isn’t just a mantra it’s how cooperative governing works. Members of the disability community need to be engaged as advisors and experts as every level of government works on #COVIDー19 rapid response.
The latest updates & resources on #COVIDー19 updated in real time by my team. Don’t hesitate to call our office for support ⬇️  https://t.co/TRD2i9CEIc

Social distancing is one of the most important steps we can take right now to save lives and protect our most vulnerable.  How does it work? Check out these simulations from the @washingtonpost   #COVIDー19   https://t.co/lAEUWuYmoM

Keeping our communities healthy means urgently taking action to protect all of our vulnerable populations - including those behind the wall.  The response from the Bureau of Prisons is insufficient.  This is about human dignity & public health.  #COVIDー19 https://t.co/DHMqi2FE8z

Just walked off the House floor.  We passed #FamiliesFirst to get critical emergency resources to help our communities respond to #COVIDー19   Now the Senate needs to pass this package immediately.  ☎️⏰ (202) 224-3121  The American people are counting on us. This can’t wait.

Our destinies are tied. We need to talk about every vulnerable population as we respond with urgency & empathy.  Join us for a national emergency call about #COVIDー19 at 3:30pm https://t.co/FH8y1Aw1iR https://t.co/KpQgfSvc6X

@tomselliott @RepPressley All restaurants & hospitality industries & workers are affected by the spread of COVID-19 because we are moving to containment strategies of social distancing. I continue to fight for protections for all workers including & especially the latter & their families.

@tomselliott @RepPressley Watch the full clip. You are the one showing division I stated facts. Sir 70% of those infected are from Europe many from Italy & we haven't named the virus for them. It is a pandemic COVID-19

@tomselliott @RepPressley Incorrect. I blamed Trump & high ranking GOP leaders for referring to it as the "Chinese Coronavirus"  perpetuating fear & racist tropes resulting in racialized attacks. And bc of fear & paranoia not supporting any biz (not just restaurants) run by our Chinese neighbors

@hasnoname006 @vanitaguptaCR Of course because we are all being told to socially isolate away from large crowds but it is another thing entirely when people don't support a business restaurant or otherwise specifically b/c it is run by a Chinese person. This is a pandemic COVID-19 not Chinese Coronavirus

@donahue_kevin @JasonLawNews @boston25 70% of those impacted are from Europe & many are Italian. We are not naming the virus after them. This is COVID-19 a pandemic. And finally the entire hospitality industry is hurting & I am fighting for protections for all of those workers & their families.

@donahue_kevin @JasonLawNews @boston25 Please take the time to watch my full line of questioning about the uninsured service workers those with autoimmune diseases etc. The point is this is not the #CHINESE Coronavirus" this is a pandemic period. & racial tropes & fear of Chinese people should not be perpetuated.

@bunkosquad @alexnazaryan By calling this the #Chinese Coronavirus" 70% of those impacted are coming from Europe many from Italy & we don't name the virus after Europeans. It's irresponsible & stigmatizing hurting people & their businesses

@RLawrence727 @vanitaguptaCR What "clears up" this specific problem (I'm referencing) is when so called leaders stop referring to it as the "Chinese Coronavirus" & when people in their paranoia & fear stop (fanned by these so called leaders) pushing racist tropes & begin supporting our neighbors & their biz

@Sussex_FAM @JasonLawNews @boston25 The priority is containment & mitigation by social distancing & testing. Racist attacks & xenophobic rants must stop this is not the "Chinese Coronavirus" anymore than it is the "European Virus" when 70% of cases are linked there it's simply COVID-19 a pandemic.
